fields.Name: DatiPilot
fields.Assignee: The DATIpilot is aimed at people from science, business and society who have innovative ideas for the transfer of knowledge. Low-threshold, flexible funding and new selection procedures are also intended to motivate actors with little experience of funding, particularly those from the field of social innovation, to participate.

fields.Name: AI-BOOST - Large AI Grand Challange
fields.Assignee: The project aims to achieve several significant impacts, with its central objectives focused on establishing and managing highly scalable AI open innovation competitions. These competitions are designed to draw the most accomplished research teams from across the European Union and Associated Countries, fostering scientific advancements in critical AI domains.

fields.Name: Women TechEU
fields.Assignee:
Women TechEU is a 2-year EU-funded project supporting women leading deep tech startup companies from Europe.
Our mission is to create a more gender-balanced entrepreneurship ecosystem. We believe that diversity drives innovation, and we are here to provide women in deep tech with more opportunities, resources, and support to thrive.

fields.Name: Philosopher in Residence Fellowship Call 2023
fields.Assignee: The Philosopher in Residence Fellowship is aimed at internationally leading and emerging representatives of the field of philosophy wishing to carry out a joint project with a TUM professor (or several TUM professors, if cooperation in a group is suitable) from the fields of natural sciences, engineering, life sciences including medicine and health sciences, economics or social sciences

fields.Name: TUM IDEA Award
fields.Assignee:
TUM Ideaward is an event where participants compete, receive constructive feedback, and undergo individual pitch training. The program includes a tailored workshop for practical startup steps, and culminates in a public award ceremony for presenting innovative ideas to a wide audience. 

\- The participation in the competition can be done as an individual (relation to TUM required) or a team
\- A team must consist of 50% TUM scientists (min. master students) and/or graduates (min. BSc.). The other 50% can be students or external members
\- Application until 30 June via the online form
\- Excluded are ideas which are already financed by funding programmes such as EXIST (except EXIST-Women) or similar  
\- Furthermore, ideas that have already been implemented in existing companies or companies where related business activities have already been initiated, are excluded from entry 
\- Founding may not take place until the prize is awarded
save-the-date for all applicants: 9 July, 3-5 p.m., Infosession go-for-it! 
\- After an initial selection, the best ideas and projects will be admitted as finalists to phase 2.

fields.Name: Hans Weisser Scholarship for Junior Entrepreneurs
fields.Assignee:
Individual learning projects where the location(s) and process are chosen in such a way that self-defined learning goals are likely to be achieved:

Research/networking trips abroad for a project, a non-profit project or a start-up idea.
Independent research projects.
Observational visits to learn from experts outside Germany.
Further qualification projects with a certificate or degree as well as study visits.

Eligible are candidates based in Germany if they:

Hold an academic degree in any subject (at least a Bachelor's degree) or - a Meisterbrief.
\- Have at least two years of professional or entrepreneurial experience.
\- Will not be older than 40 on 15 October 2024.
\- Are fluent in German.

Funding includes:
Scholarship of €1,800 per month for 2 to 12 months.
Up to €25,000 statutory fee grant for up to 12 months.
Travel allowance of €500 to up to €1,000.
Start-up grant of €500.

fields.Name: Gründungswettbewerb Digitale Innovationen (Summer Round)
fields.Assignee:
Form of application
\- Idea sketch with a maximum of 12 pages (PDF document) in phase 1
\- In phase 2, the best 50 idea sketches receive three additional pages to    respond to the feedback from phase 1
\- Optional: Supplement with a video (maximum running time 60 s)
\- Details of the people applying with the idea sketch

fields.Name: Munich Start-Up Award
fields.Assignee:
The _Munich Startup Award_ will be presented on **July 16, 2025**, during the **3rd Munich Startup Festival** at _Backstage München_.
Finalists will be selected through a preliminary round and get to pitch live on the festival's main stage in front of a top-tier jury and audience. The winning team will receive **€10,000** and the title **"Munich Startup of the Year."**

**Application Requirements:**
- Startup must be **less than five years old** as of July 16, 2025.
- Must have an **innovative and scalable** business model, product, or service.
- A **functional or demonstrable prototype** must exist.
- Startups must be listed in the _Munich Startup_ directory (with a link provided).
- Application deadline: **June 13, 2025**.

**Judging Criteria:**
- Innovation
- Business idea
- Feasibility
- Market potential
- Competitive advantage
- Team
- Scalability
- Customer engagement
- Social impact

fields.Name: Proof of Concept Förderung - TUM
fields.Assignee:
This program supports the further development of existing TUM-related intellectual property (IP) to advance critical and finance-relevant development work, potentially bridging funding gaps. In return for TUM's rights to the project results, the university will take a virtual equity stake in the spin-off.

Criteria:
\- Necessity of further development within a patentable invention or TUM patent application to enhance value.
\- Evaluation of the funding application led by TUM ForTe P&L.
\- Submission of a final report on results and fund usage.
\- Required documents: project description, current IP status, budget, support letter from a TUM chair/institute, and details on the spin-off.
\- Selection by an expert jury.

fields.Name: GO-Bio next "Phase 2"
fields.Assignee:
Aim: to increase start-up activities in the life sciences and to accelerate and make the transfer from basic research to application more efficient
Support scientists who are willing to start a company in the sustainable further development of the research project in a spin-off
Research approaches achieved through successful completion of the program are attractive to potential investors through this "de-risking" and can be spun off

fields.Name: EXIST Women
fields.Assignee:
Project designed to support women on their journey to Entrepreneurship. The goal is not to start a business but to get education. Ideally before EXIST Gründungsstipendium or EXIST Forschungstransfer.

If you plan to do it via TUM find more Info here: <https://www.tum.de/innovation/entrepreneurship/fuer-gruenderinnen-start-ups/finanzierung#c123158>

fields.Name: EIC Accelerator
fields.Assignee:
The EIC Accelerator is a funding programme under Horizon Europe that offers support to start-ups and SMEs that have a innovative, game changing product, service or business model that could create new markets or disrupt existing ones in Europe and even worldwide,
have the ambition and commitment to scale up, are looking for substantial funding, but the risks involved are too high for private investors alone to invest

fields.Name: Start-ups im Bereich der Kommunikationssysteme Phase 2
fields.Assignee: The aim of the funding measure is to create a high-performance start-up and innovation ecosystem and to reduce one-sided dependencies in the area of ​​modern and future communication technologies. The funding measure strengthens the transfer of scientific knowledge into application in a structured and flexible manner through technical innovations, targeted technical advice and scientific and technical support. The measure expands the start-up infrastructure with appropriate support and funding offers and thus creates regional and supra-regional innovation ecosystems.

fields.Name: GO-Bio next "Phase 1"
fields.Assignee:
Aim: to increase start-up activities in the life sciences and to accelerate and make the transfer from basic research to application more efficient
To prepare scientists who want to start a business for the commercial exploitation of their research results by founding a company
Research approaches achieve a higher level of maturity through successfully completed development steps

fields.Name: Dieter Schwarz Fellowship Call 2023
fields.Assignee:
Outstanding international scientists from outside TUM who intend to explore innovative, high-risk topics in the key areas researched at the TUM Campus Heilbronn together with a TUM research group are eligible for a Dieter Schwarz Fellowship. Candidates primarily have expertise in information, engineering, economics, political or social sciences

The Fellowship lasts three years, with the expectation that the Fellow will spend a total of at least nine months at TUM (which can be divided individually into several stays). In this way, TUM-IAS intends to further a lasting and productive connection on an international level.

fields.Name: MEDICE HEALTH FAMILY STARTUP DAY
fields.Assignee: On April 24, 2024, the 1st edition of the MEDICE Health Family StartUp Day will take place in Iserlohn. They will offer five selected, innovative start-ups the exclusive opportunity to present their business ideas to an experienced jury and investors.

fields.Name: Dieter Schwarz Courageous Research Grant Call 2023
fields.Assignee: Outstanding international scientists from

fields.Name: UnternehmerTUM Funding for Innovators - Prototyping Grant
fields.Assignee:
These grants give early-stage start-ups and students the freedom to hone their entrepreneurial idea and build their business.

Can be used as a “Top-Up” for building a Prototype during EXIST

fields.Name: KMU-innovativ: Biomedizin
fields.Assignee:
The Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF) funds high-risk research and development projects of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in the field of biomedicine. Supported are individual and collaborative projects that are relevant to the market positioning of SMEs, particularly in drug development. The funding typically covers 50% of eligible costs, with up to 100% for universities and non-university research institutions. The application process is two-stage: first, submit a project outline, and then, upon positive evaluation, submit a formal application. The evaluation deadlines are April 15th and October 15th.
Depending on the project, the funding can go up to 40 million euros.

fields.Name: Gründungswettbewerb Digitale Innovationen (Winter Round)
fields.Assignee:
Form of application
\- Idea sketch with a maximum of 12 pages (PDF document) in phase 1
\- In phase 2, the best 50 idea sketches receive three additional pages to    respond to the feedback from phase 1
\- Optional: Supplement with a video (maximum running time 60 s)
\- Details of the people applying with the idea sketch

fields.Name: INVEST
fields.Assignee: INVEST brings together start-ups and private investors who believe in bold ideas. The funding programme mobilizes more private venture capital from business angels and thus helps start-ups to find an investor more easily.

fields.Name: Innovationsgutschein Bayern
fields.Assignee:
40% of Expenses for a Innovation in a SME (<50 Employees) up to 30k 

up to 80 with Innovationsgutschein Plus (University as Partner involved)

If a company wants to develop a technical product and cannot carry out individual steps itself, it can award contracts. These service contracts can be subsidised. All orders that are not of a technical nature or do not have any development content are not subsidised. For example, pure management consultancy, marketing activities or the design of a website.

fields.Name: Digitales Startup des Jahres
fields.Assignee: Nutzt jetzt die Chance, um „Digitales Start-up des Jahres 2024“ des BMWK zu werden und einen der drei Preise in Höhe von 50.000 €, 30.000 € und 20.000 € zu gewinnen. Neben diesen drei von einer Jury vergebenen Preisen wird auch ein Publikumspreis in Höhe von 10.000 € verliehen, bei dem das Publikum in einer Online-Abstimmung das Start-up mit dem besten Videobeitrag wählt.

fields.Name: GO-Bio Initial "Sondierungsphase"
fields.Assignee: The GO-Bio initial programme promotes the identification and development of early life science research approaches with recognisable innovation potential. As part of the project implementation, the research results should reach a level of maturity that enables them to be continued in other established programmes for validation, start-up and company cooperation funding, such as VIP+, EXIST Transfer of Research, KMU-innovativ or GO-Bio next.

fields.Name: Proof of Concept
fields.Assignee:
Key Information:

\- Who can apply?
\- Principal Investigators with an ERC frontier research grant (Starting, Consolidator, Advanced, Synergy).
\- Must relate the Proof of Concept idea to their ERC project.

\- Eligible Proposals:
\- Only for ERC award holders to explore the commercial/societal potential of their research.
\- Focus on testing, validating, IPR protection, and engaging stakeholders.

\- Host Institution:
\- Must be based in the EU or an associated country and engage the PI for the project duration.

\- Funding:
\- EUR 150,000 for up to 18 months (usually completed within 12 months).

\- How to Apply:
\- Submit anytime before the deadline, includes forms, proposal, and documents.

\- Evaluation:
\- Assessed on innovation potential, feasibility, and PI’s leadership.
\- Single-stage process, graded “very good,” “good,” or “fail.”

fields.Name: Science4Life Venture Cup und Science4Life Energy Cup
fields.Assignee:
A total of around 80,000 euros in prize money will be distributed to the winners.

Science4Life is a registered association and supports and advises founders free of charge in setting up their company. To reflect the supra-regional nature of the competition, Science4Life organizes online seminars on topics such as patents, marketing and financing. In addition, the network's experts are available for discussions. In the various stages of the business plan competition, the teams receive expert opinions from a commercial and scientific perspective from at least three experts.

fields.Name: Start-ups im Bereich der Kommunikationssysteme Phase 1
fields.Assignee: The aim of the funding measure is to create a high-performance start-up and innovation ecosystem and to reduce one-sided dependencies in the area of ​​modern and future communication technologies. The funding measure strengthens the transfer of scientific knowledge into application in a structured and flexible manner through technical innovations, targeted technical advice and scientific and technical support. The measure expands the start-up infrastructure with appropriate support and funding offers and thus creates regional and supra-regional innovation ecosystems.

fields.Name: Rentenbank Scholarship
fields.Assignee:
The Rentenbank Scholarship supports agricultural startups with financial aid and expert guidance for innovative projects in agriculture.
Loan Eligible Expenses:
Covers costs for company stabilization and development, such as personnel, rent, and licenses. Requires a 10% equity contribution.
Grant Eligible Expenses:
Supports building company competence with up to 90% reimbursement for consulting and expert reports. Does not cover specific product development costs.

Criteria:
Eligibility: Non-publicly traded, agriculture-related startup (KU) in Germany, max. 5 years old, independent (no mergers, no profit distributions), non-primary agricultural production.
Business Model: Relevant to agriculture, forestry, or related sectors, innovative, early development stage (e.g., prototype), high growth potential, long-term economic viability.

fields.Name: K.I.E.Z. Bridge to Innovation
fields.Assignee: Up to three potential founders are supported over a period of 6 months. The sum of the possible funding is calculated from 10,000 EUR for material resources and scholarships for the founders. The amount of the respective scholarships depends on experience and educational level and can be of up to 3,000 EUR per month and founder (Student = 1.000 €; Bachelor or Master degree = 2.500 €, PHD = 3.000 €). The funding is based on the EXIST founder scholarship. For detailed information contact us.

fields.Name: EFRE – Validierungsförderung (Sachsen)
fields.Assignee:
Target Group: Research institutions
Purpose: Validation and commercial exploitation of research results

Funding:
• Program Module: Up to EUR 100,000
• Individual Project Module: Up to EUR 250,000
• Orientation Projects: Up to EUR 15,000
Funding Rate: Up to 90% of expenses
Application: Submit proposals to SAB before the start of the project, according to the funding calls.

fields.Name: START-UP TRANSFER.NRW
fields.Assignee:
\*\*Eligibility:\*\*  
Funding is available to research and educational institutions in NRW where founders are employed for their startup projects. No company may exist based on the idea before the funding starts, including shell companies or spin-offs. Diversification of existing companies is excluded.  

\*\*Scope of Funding:\*\*  
Supports market-oriented development of innovative products, services, and processes with high market potential, including proof of concept, prototyping, and business plan development for startups and early growth. Projects must fall under industrial research or experimental development.

\*\*Funding Details:\*\*  
Up to €270,000 for 24 months, with applicants contributing at least 10%. Institutions provide infrastructure and mentoring. Founders must hold an academic degree; teams may include one non-academic expert if larger than two members.

fields.Name: KMU-innovativ: Interaktive Technologien für Gesundheit und Lebensqualität
fields.Assignee:
The Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF) funds research projects in the field of interactive technologies for health and quality of life. Supported areas include:
• Digitally Assisted Health and Care
• Livable Spaces: Smart, Sustainable, and Innovative
SMEs, companies, universities, and research institutions can receive grants for individual and collaborative projects, typically covering up to 50% of eligible costs, with up to 100% for universities. The application process is two-stage: project proposals must be submitted by April 15th or October 15th each year. Upon positive evaluation, applicants are invited to submit a formal application via easy-Online.

fields.Name: KMU-innovativ: Materialforschung (ProMat_KMU)
fields.Assignee:
Supports SMEs in cutting-edge research by simplifying the application process and expanding advisory services.

Scope:
\- Focus: Risky, industry-led R&D and pre-competitive development.
\- Areas: Health, sustainable construction, sensor tech, energy, resource management, mobility.
\- Technology: Material development, including nanotechnology.

Eligibility:
\- Criteria: Excellence, innovation, societal need, relevance.
\- Submission: Anytime; evaluations on April 15 and October 15.

Support:
\- Initial Guidance: "Lotsendienst für Unternehmen."
\- Technical Queries: Contact project sponsors.
\- Consultation: Recommended for first-time applicants; online tool available.

fields.Name: Flügge
fields.Assignee: Funding opportunity similar to EXIST GS but with a focus on Bavaria. Can be used as follow-on financing for EXIST or when EXIST was not successful

fields.Name: AI Founders
fields.Assignee:
AI Founders is programme by Campus Founders (CF) in Heilbronn (HN).
CF is the equivalent of UTUM in HN.
The programme lasts 3 months & it runs twice a year (April - June, Oct - Dec).
This is for startups that are early stage (pre-seed, usually no prior VC funding).
10 - 12 startups are accepted in every batch
Startups should work on a product with some AI.
Startups get 25k equity free, accommodation in HN, workshops on generic business themes (sales, pitching etc) & AI / tech workshops.
At the end of the programme startups can get an investment of 100k as a convertible / SAFE note.

fields.Name: Start?Zuschuss!
fields.Assignee: Subsidy for Teams incorporating in Bavaria.

fields.Name: TigerLaunch
fields.Assignee: TigerLaunch is an entrepreneurship competition for student-founders to connect with the judges in venture capital and showcase their work for a chance to win $60,000 in non-equity funding.

fields.Name: Dieter Schwarz Fellowship Call 2023
fields.Assignee: Outstanding international scientists from outside TUM who intend to explore innovative, high-risk topics in the key areas researched at the TUM Campus Heilbronn together with a TUM research group are eligible for a Dieter Schwarz Fellowship. Candidates primarily have expertise in information, engineering, economics, political or social sciences. It is not possible to apply for the Fellowship on one's own, but a nomination must be made by a TUM professor

fields.Name: SPRIND
fields.Assignee:
PROJECT GMBH: Following a successful analysis and evaluation process, SPRIND, at present, has the right to establish project subsidiaries for projects with promising breakthrough potential which are funded with between 4 and 15 million EUR annually by the Federal Government. During the evaluation process, validation studies can be commissioned to clarify individual questions pertaining to a project application.
CHALLENGES: Teams taking part in our innovation contests, our SPRIND Challenges, can currently receive funding of between around 500,000 and 3 million euros, depending of the stage and topic of the Challenge. The funding is provided as pre-commercial procurement for research and development services.
FUNKEN: Like its big sister SPRIND Challenges, SPRIND Funke is an innovation competition for world changers - but with a much shorter duration. Depending on the topic and stage of the spark, we currently fund the teams in the SPRIND Sparks with up to EUR 100,000. The funding is provided as a pre-commercial contract for research and development services.

fields.Name: Innovationswettbewerb München
fields.Assignee:
With the innovation competition, the City of Munich calls for the submission of innovative solution proposals for specific urban challenges every year. The aim is to develop new smart city approaches in a co-creation process, which should then prove themselves in the urban test field.

The innovation competition is aimed at interested parties from the start-up community, students, innovation-driven founders and all creative talents who want to develop and implement viable, innovative solutions for the specified challenges.

The prize is endowed with 10,000 euros for each winning team.

In addition, the winners are given the opportunity to implement their submitted ideas in collaboration with the city administration, develop them further and test them in practice. For this co-creation phase, up to another 15,000 euros are available as a grant for in-kind services.

fields.Name: Bayerischen Forschungsstiftung
fields.Assignee:
Bavarian Research Foundation - Funding Overview:

\- Purpose:
\- Support R&D in key technologies like life sciences, ICT, materials science, energy, mechatronics, and nanotechnology.

\- Eligible Projects:
\- Collaborative projects between companies and research institutions in areas such as biotechnology, software development, energy efficiency, and automation.

\- Funding:
\- Covers basic research, industrial research, and experimental development.
\- Feasibility studies funded in exceptional cases.

\- Application:
\- Evaluated based on legal and EU regulations, with no legal entitlement to funding.

fields.Name: BAYTOU
fields.Assignee:
The Bavarian program to promote technology-oriented business start-ups - BayTOU, supports company founders and young companies in the development of new products, processes and technical services.

The aim of the funding is to encourage the founding of companies in promising technological areas and thus contribute to the creation of highly qualified jobs and to strengthening the competitiveness of the Bavarian economy.

⚠️ Funding 36k - 58k; For Software can go up to 150k max

fields.Name: Innovationsprogramm für Geschäftsmodelle und Pionierlösungen
fields.Assignee:
\- The current IGP call was launched on 11.12.2024 and focuses on:  
  \- Business models and pioneering solutions for better use of data and AI  
  \- New approaches for using data from science, business, administration, or culture  
  \- Innovative concepts for data sharing or pooling  
  \- Development of responsible data and AI ecosystems  
  \- AI applications such as "AI for good," services, or forward-looking solutions for challenges in the AI context  
  \- Specialist training and information offerings on AI or data usage  

\- The submission deadline is February 11, 2025, at 3:00 PM  

\- Funding details:  
  \- Provided as non-repayable grants under de-minimis rules  
  \- Feasibility projects: maximum eligible costs of 80,000 euros  
  \- Market-ready projects: maximum eligible costs of 330,000 euros  

\- Funding rates by applicant type:  
  \- Micro-enterprises with fewer than 10 employees and revenue or balance of less than 2 million euros  
    \- 70 percent for feasibility projects (up to 56,000 euros)  
    \- 55 percent for market-ready projects (up to 181,500 euros)  
  \- Non-profit SMEs, such as gGmbH, must meet EU SME criteria and operate entrepreneurially  
  \- Research institutions, including universities, are only eligible in collaboration with a fundable enterprise

fields.Name: Innovationsförderung des BMEL (Rahmenprogramm)
fields.Assignee:
The Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture (BMEL) funds research and development projects in the agriculture and food industry. Supported activities include:
• Research and development projects to enhance innovation and innovation capacity.
• Studies on societal, legal frameworks, and future innovation fields.
• Networking projects to improve knowledge transfer.
Funding is provided as a grant:
• Industrial research/feasibility studies: Up to 50% of costs.
• Experimental development: Up to 25% of costs.
Project proposals can be submitted as part of calls for proposals to the BLE, and additionally twice a year through the German Innovation Partnership for Agriculture (DIP).

fields.Name: Protoype Fund
fields.Assignee:
The Prototype Fund is the first low-threshold funding program for independent developers and small teams developing innovative open source software. We provide tech-savvy civil society with access to the resources and processes needed to engage in the development of user-centered, innovative software projects for society.

Apply with your ideas for innovative open source software with added value for society! You will receive up to €95,000 in six months or €158,000 in ten months of funding from the Federal Ministry of Education and Research. We will also provide you with coaching, advice and networking opportunities.

fields.Name: EXIST Forschungstransfer I
fields.Assignee:
Equity Free funding for Deeptech Startups based on previous research . Up to 250.000 € for personal cost, resources and coaching. You can apply for higher funding if required for the project. 

The program can have different duration. Please discuss with TUM Startup Consultancy which one is applicable for your individual project.

fields.Name: Rudolf Diesel Industry Fellowship Call 2023
fields.Assignee:
One Rudolf Diesel Industry Fellowship will be awarded to an outstanding researcher from industry who would like to expand their connection to a TUM research group

The Fellowship lasts three years, part of which is expected to be spent at TUM in order to develop an intensive collaboration with the hosting TUM research group. Throughout the affiliation period, the Rudolf Diesel Industry Fellow may offer special courses and lectures in their field of expertise to enhance the connection between the university and industry.

fields.Name: GO-Bio initial "Machbarkeitsphase"
fields.Assignee: The GO-Bio initial programme promotes the identification and development of early life science research approaches with recognisable innovation potential. Projects with industry partner possible.

fields.Name: EXIST Gründungsstipendium
fields.Assignee: EXIST Scholarship is a one year program designed to help innovative Startups with their market entry. Up to 3.000 € Scholarships for up to 3 People, 30.000 € for ressources & 5.000 € for additional Coaching

fields.Name: TUM-Proof of Concept Förderung
fields.Assignee: For start-up-related projects, support for the further development of existing start-up-relevant IP at TUM represents an opportunity to advance and complete important and financing-relevant development work and to bridge any funding gaps.

fields.Name: BayStartup Businessplan Wettbewerb
fields.Assignee:
\- Feedback from our renowned expert jury with serial founders, business angels, VCs & Co.
\- Prize money totaling € 85,000
\- Visibility in our network and in the public eye
\- Access to the BayStartUP offer: online tutorials, (free) coaching, exclusive events, access to the investor network

fields.Name: KfW Award
fields.Assignee: From April 1, 2024, founders can once again apply for the KfW Entrepreneurs' Award. With this prestigious competition, KfW honors start-ups from all over Germany that are to receive public recognition for their ideas and courage. As part of the award, prize money totaling EUR 35,000 will be awarded.

fields.Name: M4 Award
fields.Assignee:
What?
The pre-seed competition m4 Award is awarded by the Bavarian State Ministry of Economic Affairs, State Development and Energy.
Who?
The m4 Award is aimed at academic research projects with spin-off potential in the field of biomedicine.
Why?
Up to five teams receive up to 500.000 Euro for up to 2 years. This is intended to ensure the ability to obtain follow-up financing. In addition, all awarded projects receive intensive project support on the way to founding a company.

fields.Name: VIP+
fields.Assignee:
The VIP+ funding program supports scientists in examining and proving the innovation potential of research results and in developing possible areas of application.
Applications are always open and projects can be submitted on a rolling basis.

fields.Name: Hans Fischer Senior Fellowship
fields.Assignee:
Up to 10 Hans Fischer (Senior) Fellowships will be awarded to outstanding international scientists from outside TUM who intend to explore innovative, high-risk topics in their research areas together with a TUM research group.

The Fellowships last three years, with the expectation that the Fellow will spend a total of at least nine months at TUM (which can be divided individually into several stays). In this way, TUM-IAS intends to further a lasting and productive connection on an international level.

fields.Name: Medical Valley Award
fields.Assignee:
Der Medical Valley Award ist ein Vorgründungsvorhaben des Bayerisches Staatsministerium für Wirtschaft, Landesentwicklung und Energie.
Bisher wurde der Medical Valley Award 4-mal vergeben, wobei insgesamt 30 Forschungsprojekte gefördert werden konnten. 
Der Medical Valley Award richtet sich an akademische Forschungsprojekte mit Spin-Off Potential in einer frühen Projektphase.

fields.Name: Vision Health Pioneers
fields.Assignee:
Vision Health Pioneers Incubator is a Berlin based early-stage startup program that supports first-time founders in healthcare.
In our 9-month program, we support entrepreneurs with training, free coworking space, business opportunities and equity-free scholarship funding of up to 80,000 Euro per team.
Join our curated program to test and validate your healthtech solution, bring your startup idea to life and make patient life easier.

fields.Name: Bridge to Innovation Grant
fields.Assignee:
The "Bridge-to-Innovation Grant" supports TUM researchers who want to transfer the best innovative technology ideas from their lab to the market.
TUM offers up to €50,000 (max. €45,000 for the project, and max. €5,000 for the supporting chair) within one year to bring your scientific idea from the lab to the market in the field of food, nutrition and agriculture.

fields.Name: Digital technologies for the circular economy
fields.Assignee:
The funding is aimed at collaborative projects from business and science, especially SMEs and start-ups - and is open to all sectors and digital technologies.
 
💡 What are the goals?
 
\- Developing and testing new digital technologies, e.g. AI systems, digital twins, data platforms or the digital product passport.
\- Promoting approaches that reduce primary raw material consumption and extend product life cycles
\- Supporting projects that enable closed material and information cycles.
 
📌 What else is important?
 
\- Funding amount: Up to 20 million euros (subject to available budget funds).
\- Submission deadline for project outlines: Until March 24, 2025, 12:00 noon.
\- The projects will be selected competitively in a multi-stage process.
 
<https://www.digitale-technologien.de/DT/Redaktion/DE/Downloads/Publikation/edt_foerderaufruf_gt-kreislaufwirtschaft.pdf?__blob=publicationFile&v=7>

fields.Name: EXIST Forschungstransfer II
fields.Assignee: In EXIST phase II, a non-repayable grant of up to EUR 180,000, but no more than 75 percent of the specific costs of the project, can be awarded. ⇒ to receive the maximum of 180.000 € the Startup has to provide 60.000 € own resources; No Deadline 🔁

fields.Name: Chemstars From Lab to Market Challenge
fields.Assignee: Learn how to turn your idea into a business

fields.Name: hello tomorrow
fields.Assignee:
The Global Challenge is a renowned international startup competition organized by Hello Tomorrow since 2014. It is uniquely designed to address the needs of early-stage deep tech startups across all industries.
The Challenge gives deep tech and science-based entrepreneurs around the globe a platform for their projects, providing opportunities for equity-free funding, global visibility and connections with key players in the deep tech ecosystem. To date, previous winners and finalists have already raised more than $3 billion in funding.

Criteria:
• In the early-stage of development or the beginning of their commercialization phase (up to series A)
• Based on a new technology, a scientific discovery or a complex engineering process
• Addressing an industrial, societal or environmental unmet need or creating a new market
• Composed of a team of at least 2 people
• Not a subsidiary or spin-off of an existing company

fields.Name: Women TechEU #3
fields.Assignee:
Women TechEU targets early-stage deep tech start-ups founded, or co-founded, by women holding a top management position (CEO, CTO or equivalent). 

Women should hold at least 25% of the shares in the company at the time of submission. The company must be registered and established in an EU Member State or a Horizon Europe Associated Country for at least six months prior to the deadline of the submission date and a maximum of eight years.

The company must be a SME according to the European Commission Recommendation 2003/361/EC and must be at a stage before reaching a high fidelity Minimum Viable Product1 as well as having raised less than 1M€ in equity.

Each beneficiary will receive €75k grants (non-dilutive finance) as well as a personalised business development programme which includes mentoring, coaching and targeted training among other options.

Neither the application as a whole nor any parts of it should have already benefitted from any other similar EU programme before e.g. Women TechEU initiative, EmpoWomen etc.

<https://womentecheurope.eu/frequently-asked-questions/>

fields.Name: EIC Transition
AI+Munich
fields.Assignee:
Up to 25.000 € which can be spent for resources for prototypes, scholarships, experts or freelancers

\- Up to 25k € of funding
\- Freedom in the use of the funding
\- Little effort in applying for the funding
\- Fast approval process
\- AI Scholarship to cover your living costs

Elegibility: 

\- you have clearly defined an (initial) customer
\- you have defined the problem you want to solve and validated it with
\- potential customers
\- you have developed a suitable solution to this problem and also discussed it with potential customers
\- your solution (your value proposition) requires AI
\- you have defined the structure, size and competition of the market you    are on
\- AI expertise is present in the core team
\- there are at least two of you as a founding team
\- Your project addresses at least one of the SDGs

fields.Name: Künstliche Intelligenz für das Gemeinwohl
fields.Assignee: If you develop and test the basis for the use of “artificial intelligence” for the common good, you can receive a grant under certain conditions.
